Struct LightweightSignedQuantityRepresenter

Namespace
FinSysPlatform.Domain.Market.Representers
Assembly
FinSysPlatform.Domain.Market.dll

For optimization purposes: unlike standard SignedQuantityRepresenter this one consumes as little memory as it is possible at all First of all, this is a struct with packed fields. Struct is stored by value, which means that you will save extra 8 bytes (for x64) no having a reference to it. Also, struct has no inheritance, VM table and other things which also saves some bytes. For x64 application storing of one instance of SignedQuantityRepresenter needs in average 40 bytes (8 bytes of reference included) whereas LightweightSignedQuantityRepresenter needs only 9 bytes TODO Support IEquatable, IComparable for proper sorting and grouping in grids

[PublicAPI]
public readonly struct LightweightSignedQuantityRepresenter : ISignedQuantityRepresenter, IEquatable<LightweightSignedQuantityRepresenter>
